title: [K-12] Microlearning for Social Competency Development Using Systematic Training Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and willingness to engage in societal participation
context.additional_context: Formative Assessment-Based Social Competency Development Program in Smartphone-Centric, Technology-Constrained Settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more systematic training models for solving everyday problems.
Learners can complete over 80% of 10-minute microlearning content provided in a mobile environment
Learners can improve their social problem-solving competency, identified through formative assessments, by at least 20%

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
